solution_line_template: First, subtract the number of days Jenna can't read from the number of days in September: {days_in_september} days - {days_cant_read} days = <<{days_in_september}-{days_cant_read}={reading_days_after_busy_period}>>{reading_days_after_busy_period} days.

Then subtract the one day when Jenna will read 100 pages: {reading_days_after_busy_period} days - {flight_day_count} day = <<{reading_days_after_busy_period}-{flight_day_count}={remaining_reading_days}>>{remaining_reading_days} days.

Now subtract the {pages_on_flight} pages Jenna will read on her flight from her overall goal: {overall_goal_pages} pages - {pages_on_flight} pages = <<{overall_goal_pages}-{pages_on_flight}={pages_remaining_after_flight}>>{pages_remaining_after_flight} pages.

Finally, divide that number of pages by the number of days Jenna will read the standard amount: {pages_remaining_after_flight} pages / {remaining_reading_days} days = <<{pages_remaining_after_flight}/{remaining_reading_days}={pages_per_day}>>{pages_per_day} pages per day.
